tweets.text: Israeli Channel 12, quoting senior US officials, says that an attack on Iran will happen and that it is only a matter of time.

President Trump, after being read hostile posts from Ayatollah Khamenei’s X account, said Iran’s rulers govern through repression and violence, accusing Khamenei of destroying the country and saying “leadership is about respect, not fear and death.”
Trump says thousands of protesters were killed in Iran, a claim he made explicitly for the first time.
BREAKING: Trump calls for new leadership in Iran - POLITICO interview

Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei says Iran considers the U.S. president “criminally responsible” for casualties, damages, and what he called false accusations against the Iranian nation, according to Mehr News.
Over 3,090 confirmed killed amidst Iran's protests, with 3,882 more cases under investigation - HRANA
BREAKING: Massacres in Tehran on January 8th and 9th were mainly carried out by the IRGC's Quds Force and their proxy forces from Pakistan, Iraq and Afghanistan - Iran International
BREAKING: Internet has been partially restored in Iran
NEW: Iranian state-affiliated media reporting that SMS messaging is returning in Iran
BREAKING: At least 52 prisoners have been executed in 42 Iranian prisons in the last two weeks - HRANA
European Union Aviation Safety Agency says the potential for U.S. military action has put Iranian air defence forces on heightened alert, raising the risk of misidentification within Tehran FIR.
President Trump says "no one convinced [him]" and that he convinced himself when asked whether Arab and Israeli officials convinced him not to strike Iran, per NewsNation.
Trump on Truth Social: "I greatly respect the fact that all scheduled hangings, which were to take place yesterday (Over 800 of them), have been cancelled by the leadership of Iran. Thank you!"
NEW: President Trump spoke again by phone on Thursday with Israeli PM Netanyahu about Iran, their second call in two days. - Axios

An Israeli source says that beyond concerns about retaliation, the current U.S. plan includes strikes on Iranian security force targets. However, Israel does not view the plan as strong enough to meaningfully destabilize the regime - Axios
Mossad director visits U.S. for Iran consultations - Axios

Russian President Putin and Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu discussed the Middle East and Iran, with Putin stressing political and diplomatic steps to ensure regional stability and offering Russia’s continued mediation, the Kremlin said.

Trump wanted to carry out a rapid, powerful, one-time strike on Iran to collapse the regime, but his advisors could not guarantee it would be quick or it would collapse the regime. 

The US has transitioned for now to a diplomatic path- however the US attack was postponed, not
BREAKING: US special envoy Steve Witkoff outlines four demands and asks Iran to "return to the League of Nations," threatens a "bad alternative"
Iran’s ambassador to the UN Security Council says the U.S. “should be ashamed,” claiming armed terrorists are hijacking and destroying protests in Iran – BBC News
U.S. intelligence indicates Iran is planning retaliation against U.S. targets in Iraq and Syria if it is attacked - CNN
Trump wants to avoid a longer commitment in Iran - CNN
U.S. intelligence had not indicated the killings had stopped [in Iran] at the time Trump said they had in the Oval Office - CNN
The head coach of Esteghlal FC, Iran's most decorated football club, says he has taken refuge in the Portuguese Embassy in Tehran as several of his players and staff have fled the country
Netanyahu told Trump to wait as Israel needs more time to prepare, and Israel does not see the current US plan against Iran as strong or effective enough - Axios
According to The New York Times Netanyahu asked Trump to delay the attack, fearing that Israel was not ready for an Iranian response.
Claims from hardliner politicians in Iran that former Iranian president Hassan Rouhani and JCPOA architect Javad Zarif were arrested are fake news - Amwaj media
NewsNation corroborates earlier reporting that Gulf states worked to convince Trump to "give Iran a chance."

The U.S. Treasury imposed sanctions on senior Iranian security officials involved with the nation's violent crackdown on demonstrators, including Ali Larijani, and 18 individuals and entities tied to Bank Melli and Shahr Bank.
BREAKING: Iran's Pakistan envoy tells Pakistan-based Dawn News Trump informed Iran he does not intend to attack

Qatar, Saudi Arabia, and Oman have lobbied the Trump administration against striking Iran, per the NYT, citing fears that "regime change" could destabilize the region and allow Israel to move to fill that “vacuum.”
Trump posts on Truth Social: “FoxNews: “Iranian protester will no longer be sentenced to death after President Trump’s warnings. Likewise others.” This is good news. Hopefully, it will continue!”
A senior Iranian official said Iran had told regional countries hosting US bases, such as Saudi Arabia and Turkey, that it would attack those bases in the event of a US strike - The Guardian
US Secretary of the Treasury Scott Bessent says that "millions of dollars are being smuggled out of [Iran] by the leadership of the Islamic Republic" and that the US is "tracking this money"

Iran-related thread.

Starting at 20:02 UTC, a pair of USAF C-17As set to depart from Al-Udeid AB, Qatar (OTBH) were instructed to "return to the chalks" and that their mission to Chania, Greece (LGSA) had been scrubbed. They were instructed then to wait for more info.

BREAKING: Iran recently told Qatar they would strike them in retaliation if the US struck Iran, a senior official says - Washington Post

Trump told his national security team what he wants any US military action in Iran to "achieve" on Tuesday, and the Defense Department presented Trump with tailored options to meet his stated objectives on Wednesday.

One US official says Trump is ready to follow through on his
BREAKING: Airspace closure over Iran extended to 03:30 UTC
Trump questioned whether Iranian opposition figure Reza Pahlavi would have enough support inside Iran to lead the country - Reuters
The US has called for an emergency UN Security Council meeting on the situation in Iran, according to diplomats - Al Jazeera
NBC reports Trump wants any U.S. action on Iran to be “swift” and “decisive.”
Air India: Due to the developing situation in Iran, flights that normally overfly the region are taking alternate routes, which could cause delays.
Iran FM Abbas Araghchi to Trump: “Don’t make the same mistake you made in June. You failed in June, and you’ll get the same result.”
Iran FM Abbas Araghchi claims the protests were peaceful for ten days and says authorities “tolerated” them, but alleges they later turned into a “terrorist operation.”
Iran FM Abbas Araghchi says Iran has negotiated with the U.S. several times but calls each round a “very negative experience,” asking: “Why should we negotiate with the United States?”
Iran FM Abbas Araghchi says Iran has “every right” to conduct nuclear enrichment, insisting it is for peaceful purposes.
Iran FM Abbas Araghchi says there will be no hangings “today or tomorrow,” but says he can’t confirm what may happen on Friday.

Iran FM Abbas Araghchi says “a war was started against us,” calling threats from Trump and European officials “normal wartime rhetoric,” and says Iran views Jan. 8–10 as a continuation of the earlier 12-day war.
BREAKING NEWS: Iran issues NOTAM to close all airspace
A Western official says all signals are that a "US attack [on Iran] is imminent" - Reuters

The report on Israel-Iran dialogue via Russia originates from December 2025, before the Iran protests even began, and arose due to Israeli concerns Iran was preparing a preemptive strike.

It is safe to say the situation has seriously changed since then.
"There is a signal tonight from the British government that unspecified US/Trump action against Iran is imminent" - ITV News
Utter confusion on Iran among senior diplomats according to WSJ reporter Laurence Norman.
Trump: Iran said they were shooting back at people with guns...you know, its one of those things
BREAKING: British Embassy in Tehran has been temporarily closed – Politico
Trump: “I’ve been told the killing in Iran is stopping. There are no plans for executions.”
Spain recommends its' citizens to leave Iran and discourages travel there.
Germany has called on its nationals to leave Iran and avoid travel there, citing the risk of arbitrary arrests and an extremely volatile security situation.

Poland’s Foreign Ministry urges Polish citizens to leave Iran immediately, citing security concerns – Reuters
Italy urges its citizens to leave Iran immediately, citing security concerns, the Foreign Ministry says
Dozens of vessels bound for Iran have dropped anchor in open waters and are holding position instead of entering Iranian ports - Reuters reports.
Turkmenistan MFA says its coast guard and emergency services rescued 14 crew from the distressed Iranian-flagged cargo ship Rona in the Caspian Sea after an SOS call.
BREAKING: Martial law conditions in place in Iran - Iran International
Iran’s ambassador to Egypt tells Al Arabiya: “We are undoubtedly in a state of war,”
Inside the Trump administration, officials believe no one has the authority to speak for Iran’s Supreme Leader, the ultimate decision maker, which makes diplomacy far more difficult - CNN
Ali Shamkhani, a senior adviser to Iran’s Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei, said last year’s strike on a U.S. airbase in Qatar showed Iran’s “will and capability,” Al Jazeera reports.
Trump has pressed Elon Musk to bolster Starlink connectivity in Iran - CNN
Trump has been receiving updated lists of options for action in Iran since last week - CNN

There are signs Iran’s leadership was surprised by the scale of the protests and is trying to crack down without giving foreign governments a pretext to intervene, including restricting funerals and cutting internet access - CNN
A source familiar with the talks [about Iran] says the president is “almost certainly” going to act - CNN
NEW: Officials say Trump now feels obligated to follow through on strikes against Iran - CNN

Recent U.S. intel reporting indicate Iran is preparing options to target American bases in the Middle East, including those in Iraq & Syria, if Trump carries out military strikes, two sources say - CNN

“Saudi Arabia has informed Tehran directly that it will not be part of any military action taken against it, and that its territory and airspace will not be used for that purpose,” a source close to the Saudi military tells AFP
The commander-in-chief of Iran’s Revolutionary Guards says the IRGC is at peak readiness and will deliver a decisive response to any “miscalculation” by the enemy - Tasnim

British PM Keir Starmer condemns the "sickening repression and murder of protesters by the "desperate regime" in Iran and says that the UK is working with allies on further Iran sanctions.
The Indian Embassy in Tehran has urged Indian nationals to leave Iran
Iran's Chief Justice says there will be fast trials and executions ahead- "If we want to do a job, we should do it now...If we want to do something, we have to do that fast." - AP
BREAKING: Five Iranian banks are on the brink of collapse, including Bank Sepah, one of Iran's three largest banks and the primary bank for the IRGC and Iranian military - WSJ
The Iranian Central Bank is printing money to continuously loan Iranian banks, aiming to help them stay afloat. Economists say it will cause an inflationary cycle- WSJ

Despite public saber-rattling, people close to the White House say Trump has been less certain in private and less enthusiastic than before the June bombings [on Iran]. One described it as “a coin flip.” - WaPo
European officials say Iran is offering negotiations mainly “to stall for time.” - WaPo
A European official says Iran’s leadership believes Trump would face backlash from his base if he launches attacks on Iran - WaPo
NEW: European officials believe Trump may target the leadership of organizations and forces in Iran responsible for killing protesters - WaPo
The U.S. asked European countries yesterday to share their intelligence on Iran, according to two European officials - Wapo
Two officials say VP Vance is worried the U.S. could be “pulled deeper into a Middle East entanglement.” over Iran - Wapo
JD Vance and Marco Rubio are expected to present Iran response options to Trump at the NSC meeting “without preference.” - WaPo
People close to the White House say strikes on Iran would be dangerous, with U.S. military and intelligence potentially attempting “high-risk operations.” - WaPo
The head of the U.S. oil industry’s top lobbying group said Tuesday that American producers are prepared to be a “stabilizing force” in Iran if the regime there falls - POLITICO

Iranian officials say situation now is different than June 2025, as any US strike would be viewed as an existential threat to the regime. US officials say Iran only has 1/3 the number of missile launchers they had prior to the war in June - CNN
Trump says Iran "better behave" after a reporter mentioned that Iran said it would retaliate if the U.S. strikes.
HRANA says at least 18,137 people have been arrested in connection with the protests in Iran.
HRANA (Human Rights Activists News Agency), a U.S.-based rights group, has raised its reported Iran protest-linked death toll from 2,003 to 2,403.
State Department issues new travel alert ordering Americans to leave Iran now. Says “protests across Iran continue to escalate.”
Israel is raising the alert in Israeli embassies and Jewish communities worldwide in preparation for anticipated attacks  - Mako

CBS: “They’ve started killing protesters [in Iran].”
Trump: “Yep.”
Trump talking about Iran “The endgame is to win. I like winning. Define it as Venezuela, Soleimani, al-Baghdadi.” - CBS
Trump says U.S. will take "very strong action" if Iran starts hanging protesters - CBS
Trump on Iran: “We don’t like what’s happening there. We’ll see how it works out for them, it’s not going to work out well.” – CBS

Jan 13 (Reuters) - Despite Iran's nationwide protests and years of external pressure, there are as yet no signs of fracture in the Islamic Republic's security elite that could bring an end to one of the world's most resilient governments.
NEW: Saudi Arabia directed local media to limit both its coverage and support of the demonstrations to avoid Iranian retaliation - WSJ
The UAE is taking a tougher line rather than trying to appease Iran, a stance that could make it a target for Iranian retaliation - WSJ

VP Vance is set to lead the Iran strategy meeting this afternoon with the national security team, a source familiar with the matter tells NewsNation and CBS
Trump comments on Iran during his Detroit economic speech, mostly repeating what he already said on Truth Social.

UPDATE: Iran strategy being talked about in multiple Trump admin discussions today, but the big meeting, the NSC principals committee meeting with @VP Vance as chair, is later today, sources told @CBSNews. It's scheduled for 4 pm, I'm told.

BREAKING NEWS: At least 12,000, possibly up to 20,000 people have been killed in Iran - CBS

Ukraine transmits in Persian: "We stand with the people of Iran."
Russia condemns U.S. involvement in Iranian internal affairs. - Iran Intl

Iran’s Army Commander says preparations made over the six months since the 12-day war are fully aligned with current threats, adding Iran is stronger than before the war. He says the “Zionist regime’s” threat against Iran is real and is being taken seriously.
NYT, quoting an unnamed Iranian health ministry official, claims at least 3,000 dead in Iran, with the number expected to grow.

Casualty numbers from Iran's protests remain deeply uncertain, regime sources have told Reuters that around 2,000 people were killed, while opposition sources claim the toll could be as high as 12,000, but what is clear is that thousands have died across Iran over the past week

BREAKING: The Pentagon is presenting a wider range of strike options in Iran than previously reported, options include nuclear, ballistic missile targets - NYT

Trump is exploring options for diplomacy, but some US officials believe Iran is simply trying to delay a US attack rather than seriously engage in diplomacy - NYT

Australia is the second UN member state to claim the Islamic Republic is illegitimate, after Israel.
Trump told NBC after being asked about a US response in Iran: "It could happen."

Iran: Protests across Iran are escalating. Increased security measures, road closures, public transportation disruptions, and internet blockages are ongoing. Airlines continue to limit or cancel flights to and from Iran, with several suspending service until Friday, January 16.

NEW: New footage of protests in Tehran was sent to Indypersian, reportedly from tonight, according to the text on the video.

An informal group of academics and professionals calculated that the number of protester deaths could have reached 6,000 in Tehran on Saturday, counting only "reports from a handful of Tehran hospitals." - TIME

Senior Israeli officials believe Iran's request for negotiations with the US is a deception aimed to prevent a US attack on the country - Israel Channel 12
The last Iranian state-affiliated media outlet that had stayed online, Tasnim, has now gone offline as Iran crosses the 100-hour-mark of nonstop internet blackout.
Non-essential staff at France’s embassy in Iran have left the country, sources say - Bloomberg reports

Some in the U.S. doubt that Iran is genuine about ending its nuclear program, telling Trump that Tehran may be finding a way to buy time and avoid American airstrikes and maintain its legitimacy despite widespread popular unrest - WSJ

Some officials say Trump may strike first and then seek serious talks with Tehran afterward - WSJ
NEW: Trump currently favors attacking Iran - WSJ
Some senior administration aides, led by Vice President JD Vance, are urging Trump to try diplomacy before retaliating against Iran for killing protesters - WSJ
Sweden’s Foreign Ministry is urging all Swedish citizens to leave Iran, advising against all travel and telling Swedes currently in the country to leave
BREAKING: A state of emergency has been declared in several Iranian cities, several sources in Iran tell Norwegian outlet Aftenposten

U.S. Ambassador to Israel Mike Huckabee tells Sky News the U.S. has no plans to intervene in Iran, saying “neither the U.S. nor Israel is making plans to engage.”
Iran’s public messaging differs from what it is privately conveying to Washington - White House says

A U.S. official told Al Jazeera that American forces in the Middle East are ready for any contingency and any mission, and to defend themselves and U.S. interests. The official added that planning for military options against Iran has reached advanced stages.

BREAKING: The President of the European Parliament says Iranian diplomats, officials, and regime representatives are banned with immediate effect from all Parliament premises in Brussels, Strasbourg, and Luxembourg due to Tehran’s violent crackdown on protests.

NEW: The Iranian Foreign Minister has approached Steve Witkoff seeking discussions on the ongoing protests in Iran, sources say. The two sides also discussed a possible meeting between them in the coming days. - Axios

Iran’s parliamentary National Security Commission says it has evidence of U.S. and Israeli involvement in recent unrest, claiming both overt and covert documents exist. The commission said most deaths were caused by foreign-backed actors and warned of a “decisive” response. -
Iranian state TV says "a million" people have come out in the streets today to rally in support of the Islamic Republic

The authenticity of some of these clips and streams is called into question, as the "live" streams were edited and often experienced abrupt cuts. On a few occasions, the streams would cut to interviews- some of which, in the night (it is currently 2:25 PM in Iran.)
"Tens of thousands" protested in Tehran, per AP. Less than the "one million" proclaimed by state media, more similar to the original established goal of 100,000, albeit seemingly lower.

Iran's nationwide internet shutdown imposed on 8 January has now lasted more than 84 hours, monitor NetBlocks says.
Iranian state TV reports that there are pro-government demonstrations ongoing in Hamadan, Ilam, Kerman, and Rasht.

Other options include boosting antigovernment sources online, sanctions on the Iranian regime, and military strikes. Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth and Joint Chiefs Chair Gen. Dan Caine are expected to attend the Tuesday meeting - WSJ
